A **silver saber** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a one-handed weapon that uses the **saber** skill, and is made of [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver").

The silver saber is the [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") for the [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir") and [Werebane](/wiki/Werebane "Werebane").

## Saber skill

| Saber   |                                                                                                                                                        |
| ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Max     | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                                                                              |
| Basic   | - [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer"), [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") |
| Skilled | * [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")                                                    |
| Expert  | - [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist")                                                                                                    |

The silver saber is the only weapon to use the saber skill.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 296a3ac2](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/296a3ac246ae12218eccff46d3ef79f46eb9068f), the [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar") skill is merged into the saber skill, and Barbarians can reach Skilled in saber to maintain consistency with the former scimitar skill.

## Generation

Silver sabers make up about 0.6% of randomly generated weapons created on the floor, as [death drops](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop"), or in [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") - they can be sold in general stores, used armor dealerships and antique weapon outlets.

[Watch captains](/wiki/Watch_captain "Watch captain") and [Yendorian army](/wiki/Yendorian_army "Yendorian army") captains have a 1⁄2 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a silver saber.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

In a game with [Orcish Town](/wiki/Orcish_Town "Orcish Town"), the [orc-captain](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain") that acts as leader of the invading horde has a 1⁄2 chance of carrying the watch captain's silver saber.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a chance lower than 1% of generating with a silver saber as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Strategy

The silver saber is a respectable weapon in its own right, and is a common secondary choice when #[twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweaponing "Twoweaponing") for the bonus damage against silver-hating monsters such as [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade"), [demons](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON"), [werecreatures](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature"), and [vampires](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)"). Due to their rarity, characters seeking a silver saber often consider killing the watch captain in [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown") if they generate with one - those trying to avoid penalties to [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") can use a suitably strong [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet"). Players that do not have a watch captain with a saber or do not wish to take the risk of killing one (indirectly or other one) can search [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios") if they encounter it or head towards the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"), by which point they may also encounter at least a captain or two.

### Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from [weapon skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), or from using a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") weapon against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") or demons.

| Weapon          | Not silver-hating                                                                       | Silver-hating                                                                                        |
| --------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| +0 silver saber | ![\frac{1+8}{2}=\bold{4.5}](/images/math/7/4/e/74e52834efa4174097be171735147333.png)    | ![\frac{1+8}{2}+\frac{1+20}{2}=\bold{15}](/images/math/4/9/1/491c20d97696fb10367b0beedba5b863.png)   |
| +7 silver saber | ![\frac{1+8}{2}+7=\bold{11.5}](/images/math/9/4/7/94719b6068eeb41a5cfcaa5634e6b33a.png) | ![\frac{1+8}{2}+\frac{1+20}{2}+7=\bold{22}](/images/math/d/d/0/dd0a3763357b07369642322d748ddf8b.png) |

## History

The silver saber first appears in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), which introduces Grayswandir and changes Werebane's base item from a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") to a silver saber.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Saber](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saber "wikipedia:Saber")***

The saber is a curved, single-edged sword with a cross-guard connecting to the pommel (tip of the hilt). It descends from the similar West Asian [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), which has a simple cross-guard. The blade of a saber is backward-curved as opposed to the forward curving associated with many similar swords, and was designed for use by mounted cavalry, such as the Central European hussars and the light cavalry of the 16th-to-19th centuries. The saber's cross-guard was improved as the development of firearms made many forms of armor ineffective.

## Variants

Variants with [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials") often change the item's name to the **saber**, and may also change its default material of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), giving it the possibility of generating as silver. Some variants also add more weapons that use the saber skill.

In variants that incorporate the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") role, [prison guards](/wiki/Prison_guard "Prison guard") have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with a silver saber.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds the [rapier](/wiki/Rapier "Rapier") as a weapon that uses the saber skill.

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), silver sabers are replaced with iron sabers. Grayswandir retains its silver damage as a unique property of the artifact, rather than an intrinsic property of the base item. The scimitar skill is also merged into the saber skill.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the silver saber is simply known as a saber, but has a default material of silver and always shows the material's name. dNetHack also adds the rapier, [lightsaber](/wiki/Lightsaber#dNetHack "Lightsaber"), [crow-quill](/index.php?title=Crow-quill\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Crow-quill (page does not exist)") and [rakuyo](/wiki/Rakuyo "Rakuyo") as new weapons that use the saber skill. The basic lightsaber is the only one of its weapon type that uses the saber skill, and the rakuyo can be detached into two weapons: a rakuyo-saber form for the main hand, and a rakuyo-dagger for the off-hand.

Several artifacts use the saber skill in some form:

- [Demonbane](/wiki/Demonbane "Demonbane") has its base item changed to a silver saber from vanilla *NetHack*.
- [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand") and [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand") can generate in saber form.
- The [Blade Singer's Saber](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Blade_Singer.27s_Saber "DNetHack artifacts") is an artifact rakuyo that also unrestricts the saber skill if gifted.
- The [Crescent Blade](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Crescent_Blade "DNetHack artifacts") is an artifact silver saber that favors [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)").
- [The Annulus](/wiki/The_Annulus "The Annulus") is the [Anachrononaut](/wiki/Anachrononaut "Anachrononaut") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") and can be invoked to change between a variety of forms at will, including a lightsaber.
- [The Iconoclast](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Iconoclast "DNetHack artifacts") is an artifact silver saber wielded by [Daemon](/wiki/Daemon "Daemon").
- The [Saber of Sabaoth](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Saber_of_Sabaoth "DNetHack artifacts") is a large artifact silver saber that [Throne Archons](/wiki/Throne_Archon "Throne Archon") can generate with.

[The Air Crystal](/wiki/Crystals_\(dNetHack\) "Crystals (dNetHack)") boosts your skill in sabers by one level while carried.

The [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") [Berith](/wiki/Berith "Berith") grants skill in sabers while bound, and a saber is one of the items that his seal can be drawn around in order to summon him.

[Argentum golems](/wiki/Argentum_golem "Argentum golem") have a 1⁄12 chance of generating with a silver saber. The [Rebel Ringleader](/wiki/Rebel_Ringleader "Rebel Ringleader"), the [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") for the default [Noble quest](/wiki/Noble_quest "Noble quest"), will always generate with a silver saber.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), sabers have a default material of iron and can generate as silver. Grayswandir and Werebane are still generated as silver sabers.

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") merges the scimitar skill into the saber skill.

Sabers have a default material of iron and can generate as silver. Grayswandir and Werebane are still generated as silver sabers. A saber can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") and a scimitar; a [fauchard](/wiki/Fauchard "Fauchard") can be created by combining a saber with a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), the [Mouser's Scalpel](/wiki/Mouser%27s_Scalpel "Mouser's Scalpel") and [Queen's Guard](/wiki/Queen%27s_Guard "Queen's Guard") are artifacts that use the saber skill.

The Rebel Ringleader retains her silver saber and serves as the nemesis for all Nobles.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") the rapier from SLASH'EM and the [falchion](/wiki/Falchion "Falchion") from [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") as weapons that use the saber skill, and merges the scimitar skill (which SpliceHack falchions use) into the saber skill.

Sabers behave as in EvilHack and use the same forging recipes. [Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a saber will produce a rapier, and vice versa.

## Encyclopedia entry

Flashed all their sabres bare,  
Flashed as they turned in air,  
Sab'ring the gunners there,  
Charging an army, while  
All the world wondered:  
Plunged in the battery smoke,  
Right through the line they broke;  
Cossack and Russian  
Reeled from the sabre-stroke  
Shattered and sundered.  
Then they rode back, but not--  
Not the six hundred.

\[ The Charge of the Light Brigade, by Alfred, Lord Tennyson ]

2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/mkmaze.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 760](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mkmaze.c#L760)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 155](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L155): *1⁄2 to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds*

The saber's cross-guard was improved as the development of firearms made many forms of armor ineffective.

==Variants==
Variants with [[object materials]] often change the item's name to the '''saber''', and may also change its default material of [[iron]], giving it the possibility of generating as silver. Some variants also add more weapons that use the saber skill.

In variants that incorporate the [[Convict]] role, [[prison guard]]s have a {{frac|2}} chance of being generated with a silver saber.

===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] adds the [[rapier]] as a weapon that uses the saber skill.

===NetHack brass===
In [[NetHack brass]], silver sabers are replaced with iron sabers. Grayswandir retains its silver damage as a unique property of the artifact, rather than an intrinsic property of the base item. The scimitar skill is also merged into the saber skill.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], the silver saber is simply known as a saber, but has a default material of silver and always shows the material's name. dNetHack also adds the rapier, [[Lightsaber#dNetHack|lightsaber]], [[crow-quill]] and [[rakuyo]] as new weapons that use the saber skill. The basic lightsaber is the only one of its weapon type that uses the saber skill, and the rakuyo can be detached into two weapons: a rakuyo-saber form for the main hand, and a rakuyo-dagger for the off-hand.

Several artifacts use the saber skill in some form:

* [[Demonbane]] has its base item changed to a silver saber from vanilla ''NetHack''.
* [[Fire Brand]] and [[Frost Brand]] can generate in saber form.
* The [[dNetHack artifacts#Blade Singer's Saber|Blade Singer's Saber]] is an artifact rakuyo that also unrestricts the saber skill if gifted.
* The [[dNetHack artifacts#Crescent Blade|Crescent Blade]] is an artifact silver saber that favors [[Drow (starting race)|drow]].
* [[The Annulus]] is the [[Anachrononaut]] [[quest artifact]] and can be invoked to change between a variety of forms at will, including a lightsaber.
* [[dNetHack artifacts#The Iconoclast|The Iconoclast]] is an artifact silver saber wielded by [[Daemon]].
* The [[dNetHack artifacts#Saber of Sabaoth|Saber of Sabaoth]] is a large artifact silver saber that [[Throne Archon]]s can generate with.

[[Crystals (dNetHack)|The Air Crystal]] boosts your skill in sabers by one level while carried.

The [[Spirits (dNetHack)|spirit]] [[Berith]] grants skill in sabers while bound, and a saber is one of the items that his seal can be drawn around in order to summon him.

[[Argentum golem]]s have a {{frac|12}} chance of generating with a silver saber. The [[Rebel Ringleader]], the [[quest nemesis]] for the default [[Noble quest]], will always generate with a silver saber.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], sabers have a default material of iron and can generate as silver. Grayswandir and Werebane are still generated as silver sabers.

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] merges the scimitar skill into the saber skill.

Sabers have a default material of iron and can generate as silver. Grayswandir and Werebane are still generated as silver sabers. A saber can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a [[long sword]] and a scimitar; a [[fauchard]] can be created by combining a saber with a [[spear]].

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], the [[Mouser's Scalpel]] and [[Queen's Guard]] are artifacts that use the saber skill.

The Rebel Ringleader retains her silver saber and serves as the nemesis for all Nobles.

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] the rapier from SLASH'EM and the [[falchion]] from [[SpliceHack]] as weapons that use the saber skill, and merges the scimitar skill (which SpliceHack falchions use) into the saber skill.

Sabers behave as in EvilHack and use the same forging recipes. [[Upgrading]] a saber will produce a rapier, and vice versa.
